me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry

Class Triangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry.Triangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Shape<Triangle>

    public class Triangle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Shape<Triangle>
    A polygon with 3 sides and 3 vertices.

    Update: this is about... I'd say 2 months, possibly, after I've written this code. And I would like say that this is some very respectful documentation. This must have been written by a charming young gentleman. It's so polite. "A polygon with 3 sides and 3 vertices." I can just imagine a young gentleman in a tuxedo saying those words in a respectful tone. Anyways.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getCentroid

        public static PointXY getCentroid(Line ab,
                                  Line bc,
                                  Line ca)
        Get a given triangle's "centroid." The centroid is basically the triangle's real center point.
        Parameters:
        ab - one of the three lines.
        bc - one of the three lines.
        ca - one of the three lines.
        Returns:
        the triangle's "centroid." If there is an issue computing the centroid (which shouldn't ever happen) return null.

      • scale

        public Triangle scale(double scale)
        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Resize the shape.
        Specified by:
        scale in interface Shape<Triangle>
        Parameters:
        scale - the new scale for the shape. If this number is 2, the shape will double in size. If this number is 0.5, the shape will be half the original size.
        Returns:
        the scaled shape.

      • growBy

        public Triangle growBy(double growth)
        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Resize the shape by a specific value.
        Specified by:
        growBy in interface Shape<Triangle>
        Parameters:
        growth - how much to grow the shape by. All the shape's points will be moved this distance away from their original positions.
        Returns:
        the resized shape.
